p: For Ferric reducing power, the presence of reducing agents in the extracts of plants causes thereduction of Fe + 3- ferricyanide complex to the ferrous form. Therefore, Fe + 2 can be assessed byfollowing the increase in the density of blue color in the reaction medium at700 nm [ 33]. M. spicata essential oil showed antioxidant activity with an IC 50 value of 215 ± 4.50 μg/mL while ascorbic acid and BHT as a positive control showed IC 50 values of 2.2 ± 0.1 and 18.2 ± 0.5 μg/mL, respectively. These results suggest that the essential oil of M. spicata has a remarkable potency to donate electron to reactive free radicals, converting them into more stable non-reactive species and terminating the free radical chain reaction.
